item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet? Steps To Check Allotment Status Online, Check GMP - News18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet?

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 14:39 IST

The allotment of the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is eagerly awaited as registrars are delayed due to heavy subscription bids. The latest grey market premium (GMP) stands at 46.05%, indicating a strong listing expected on January 7.

  • IPO was open from December 31 to January 2.
  • Subscription level was 227.67 times overall.
  • Retail category subscribed 101.79 times, NII portion 501.75 times, QIB category 242.4 times.
  • Profit for investors as unlisted shares trade at Rs 314, Rs 99 higher than IPO price of Rs 215.
The IPO has a size of Rs 260 crore with shares listed on BSE and NSE.

This IPO's success indicates strong market interest and positive investor sentiment ahead of its listing.

item.title: Zepto plans IPO filing by March-April; Singapore nod in for moving domicile - The Economic Times
item.description:
Zepto Plans IPO Filing by March-April; Moves Domicile to India

Publication Date: No date provided Source: ETtech

Zepto is preparing to file for an IPO by March-April 2025 and has received approval to move its holding entity from Singapore to India. The company is also finalising independent directors and deliberating on IPO size and bankers.

  • In advanced discussions to file draft documents for IPO.
  • Received approval to shift domicile from Singapore to India.
  • Aiming to become the first independent quick commerce firm to go public.
  • Finalizing independent directors as part of the IPO process.
  • Plans to raise at least $450 million, subject to change.
“We’re 100% compliant with the country’s FDI regulations and have been since day one. But we’re also rapidly moving towards having local ownership of our company.” - Aadit Palicha, CEO

Zepto's move to India comes amid scrutiny over compliance with local FDI regulations. The company aims to position itself favorably in the competitive landscape.

item.title: Refinancing on agenda, Reliance raises dual currency loan of $3 billion - The Economic Times
item.description:
Reliance Raises $3 Billion Dual Currency Loan

Date: Mumbai, Source: Economic Times

Reliance Industries has successfully secured a $3 billion loan from 11 banks, marking the largest loan deal by the company in nearly two years. The funds will primarily be used to refinance loans maturing in 2025.

  • The five-year loan includes $450 million in Japanese yen.
  • The deal was priced at 120 basis points above the three-month secured overnight financing rate (SOFR).
  • Major banks involved include Bank of America, DBS Bank, and HSBC.
  • Reliance has drawn down about $700 million from the loan so far.
  • Further syndication of the loan is anticipated to attract more banks later this quarter.
“Almost all of the money raised will be used to refinance loans which are maturing in 2025.”

This loan not only showcases Reliance's strong market position but also reflects confidence among lenders despite the upcoming financial obligations.

item.title: FDIC Took Issue With Banks Using Public Blockchains Like Ethereum, FOIA Docs Reveal - Decrypt
item.description:
FDIC Took Issue With Banks Using Public Blockchains Like Ethereum, FOIA Docs Reveal

Publication Date: Recent Disclosure, Source: Coinbase

American banks have been discouraged by the FDIC from utilizing public blockchain networks to offer services, according to documents obtained via the Freedom of Information Act. These revelations come from unredacted letters exchanged between the FDIC and member banks.

  1. FDIC has expressed concerns over banks using public blockchains like Ethereum instead of private networks.
  2. Regulatory bodies are pushing for detailed review processes before banks can launch products on public blockchains.
  3. Other letters indicate the FDIC has ordered banks to pause all crypto asset-related activities.
  4. Coinbase's legal officer claims these efforts are part of a wider governmental initiative against the cryptocurrency sector.
“They show a coordinated effort to stop a wide variety of crypto activity,” - Paul Grewal, Coinbase Chief Legal Officer.

This situation highlights tension between federal regulators and the expanding crypto industry, raising questions about the future of blockchain integration in traditional banking.

item.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eases on Friday as investors look elsewhere - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD Dips Below $2,650 as Market Sentiment Shifts

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

XAU/USD dipped on Friday, with gold prices falling roughly two-thirds of a percent and dipping back below $2,650 per ounce as market sentiment recovers from the early week’s risk-off appetite.

  • Gold bids cooled back below $2,650, crimping the week’s gains.
  • Market risk appetite recovered with improved US ISM data.
  • Federal Reserve's Barkin soothes investor concerns on interest rates and tariffs.
“Markets shouldn’t be too worried about a potential 10%-20% fee on all imported goods into the US.” - Tom Barkin

With upcoming economic events like the Nonfarm Payrolls print, market participants are closely watching how gold prices will react to broader economic trends.

item.title: SBI, HDFC Bank raise FD rates for segments like seniors above 80 - The Times of India
item.description:
SBI and HDFC Bank Increase FD Rates for Seniors Over 80

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

India's leading financial institutions, SBI and HDFC Bank, have announced an increase in fixed deposit (FD) rates for senior citizens, specifically targeting those aged 80 and above. This decision is aimed at providing better returns on investments for older customers during a time of rising inflation.

  • SBI raised the FD interest rate for senior citizens from 6.50% to 6.75%.
  • HDFC Bank increased the maximum interest rate on certain FDs to 7.25% for seniors.
  • This move reflects the banks' response to improving market conditions and aims to attract more deposits.
  • Senior citizens are often considered a priority segment due to their reliance on fixed incomes.
"We strive to provide financial security to our senior customers through competitive interest rates on fixed deposits." - SBI spokesperson

Both banks see this increase as a strategic move to bolster their FD portfolios while ensuring that senior citizens have access to better financial products.

item.title: PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates - News18
item.description:
PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

State-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) has revised its fixed deposit (FD) interest rates, introducing new tenures effective January 1, 2025. The new 303-day FD offers 7% interest, while the 506-day FD offers 6.7% for general citizens.

  • PNB's FD interest rates range from 3.5% to 7.25% for tenures of 7 days to 10 years.
  • The highest rate of 7.25% is applicable for a 400-day tenure.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urges banks to improve deposit mobilization for sustainable credit growth.
“While credit growth has picked up, mobilisation of deposits could further be improved to fund the credit growth sustainably.” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This revision aims to attract more deposits, reflecting efforts to enhance customer relationships and ensure efficient service delivery.

item.title: EPFO begins centralised PF pension disbursal - The Hindu
item.description:
EPFO begins centralised PF pension disbursal

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has implemented a new Centralised Pension Payments System (CPPS) aimed at streamlining the pension disbursal process, impacting over 68 lakh pensioners.

  • The CPPS is designed to facilitate seamless pension access from any bank across the country.
  • A total of ₹1,570 crore has been disbursed for December 2024.
  • The rollout includes 122 pension disbursing regional offices.
  • The pilot testing initiative was carried out in late 2024.
  • The system eliminates the need for physical verification visits for pensioners.
“This transformative initiative empowers pensioners to access their pension seamlessly from any bank, any branch, anywhere in the country.” - Mansukh Mandaviya, Union Labour Minister

The launch of the CPPS represents a significant advancement in the pension disbursement system, ensuring efficiency and accessibility for millions of pensioners.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Finalised: A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status Online, Check G - News18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Finalised: How to Check Status Online

Last Updated: January 03, 2025, 22:50 IST

The allotment of the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is set to be finalised today, with a strong demand indicated by a 227.67 times subscription rate.

  • Indo Farm Equipment shares are trading at Rs 311 per share in the grey market, a 44.65% increase over the IPO price of Rs 215.
  • The IPO was open from December 31 to January 2 and received substantial interest across all investor categories.
  • The shares will be listed on both BSE and NSE on January 7, with investors receiving bank debit messages if allotted.
  • Investors can check the status of their allotment online via the official BSE website or Mas Services Limited’s portal.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

This IPO reflects significant investor interest and signals potential strong market performance upon listing.

item.title: Google Pixel finds traction in India’s premium smartphone market as OnePlus plummets - 9to5Google
item.description:
Google Pixel Finds Traction in India’s Premium Smartphone Market as OnePlus Plummets

Publication Date: November 2024, Source: 9to5Google

Google Pixel is finally gaining traction in India’s premium smartphone market, as the brand managed to grow while OnePlus took a nosedive.

  • India saw 6.5 million premium smartphone shipments from Q1 2024 to Q3 2024, up from 4.2 million the previous year.
  • OnePlus's market share fell from 21% to just 6% in a year, while Samsung maintained a 30% share.
  • Google Pixel's growth jumped from 1% in 2023 to 5% in 2024, significantly due to the Pixel 8 being manufactured in India.
  • Apple holds a dominant position with roughly 56% market share in the premium segment.
“All the while, Apple continues to take up the bulk of the premium smartphone segment in India.”

This shift in market dynamics indicates a growing acceptance of Google Pixel among Indian consumers and highlights the declining popularity of OnePlus in the premium segment.

item.title: Wockhardt’s 2 New Antibiotics In Global Spotlight: Chairman Khorakiwala Narrates Journey | Exclusive - News18
item.description:
Wockhardt’s 2 New Antibiotics In Global Spotlight: Chairman Khorakiwala Narrates Journey | Exclusive

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: News18

Mumbai-based drugmaker Wockhardt has received final approval from India's drug regulatory authority to market its new antibiotic, Nafithromycin, effective against community-acquired bacterial pneumonia. Alongside, Zaynich has shown promise against major drug-resistant superbugs.

  • Nafithromycin branded as Miqnaf is claimed to be “10 times” more effective than current treatments.
  • The drug's launch in India is scheduled within the next few months.
  • Wockhardt has invested approximately $500 million in antibiotic research over the past two decades.
  • The development focuses on addressing rising antimicrobial resistance, with major implications for public health.
  • Zaynich is undergoing phase-III trials globally, expected to enter the Indian market by mid-2025.
“More than 50 lakh people die every year due to the resistance.” - Dr Habil Khorakiwala

The development of these antibiotics marks a significant achievement in combating drug-resistant infections, showcasing India's capability in pharmaceutical innovation.

item.title: EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed - News18
item.description:
EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Union Labour and Employment Minister, Mansukh Mandaviya, has announced that a new Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) mobile application and debit card facility will be available to subscribers by May-June. This will streamline the withdrawal process significantly.

  • The EPFO ATM card will not allow full contribution withdrawal but simplifies access to funds.
  • Work on EPFO 2.0 (IT system upgrade) is nearly complete and will precede the launch of EPFO 3.0.
  • The new system aims to centralise claim settlements.
  • Ongoing discussions between the RBI and Finance Ministry to facilitate banking services for EPFO subscribers.
  • Withdrawals will be subject to a limit and do not require prior approval from the EPFO.
“During the Modi government’s tenure from 2014 to 2024, 17.19 crore individuals secured employment.”

This initiative by the government aims to ease the withdrawal process for EPFO subscribers and improve employment opportunities.

item.title: Why Analysts Are Divided on Tesla Stock After Lackluster Q4 Deliveries Data - Investopedia
item.description:
Why Analysts Are Divided on Tesla Stock After Lackluster Q4 Deliveries Data

Date: October 2023 | Source: Investopedia

Tesla shares have fallen significantly following the news of disappointing fourth-quarter production and delivery numbers, leading to varied reactions from analysts regarding the company's future prospects.

  • Tesla shares dropped 18% over five sessions, culminating in a 6% decline to $379.28.
  • Wedbush remains optimistic, maintaining an 'outperform' rating with a price target of $515.
  • JPMorgan is bearish, suggesting a potential sales decline if EV tax credits are eliminated.
  • Ten of 19 analysts tracked rate Tesla stock as a 'buy', with an average price target of $319.72.
“They believe shares will rise this year as a second Trump term benefits Tesla by accelerating the regulatory path to the company's autonomous taxis hitting the road.” - Wedbush Analysts

Overall, the analysts exhibit contrasting views on Tesla's future, reflecting uncertainty in the market following the recent delivery data.

item.title: RBI approves amalgamation of these two banks - Have account in them? Check latest update - ET Now
item.description:
RBI Approves Amalgamation of National Co-operative Bank and Cosmos Cooperative Bank

Updated: January 3, 2025 | Source: ET Now News

The Reserve Bank of India has sanctioned the amalgamation scheme of the National Co-operative Bank Ltd., Bangalore with Cosmos Cooperative Bank Limited, Maharashtra, which will take effect on January 6, 2025.

  • The amalgamation will integrate the branches of both banks into one operational entity.
  • A monetary penalty of ₹8.30 lakh has been imposed on Cosmos Cooperative Bank for regulatory non-compliance.
  • The scheme is authorized under the Banking Regulation Act of 1949.
“The Scheme has been sanctioned in exercise of the powers conferred under Sub-Section (4) of Section 44A read with Section 56 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949,” RBI stated.

This move is significant for the banking landscape in India as it highlights regulatory oversight and compliance in the sector.

item.title: Dollar stays near two-year high, stocks struggle - Reuters
item.description:
Dollar Stays Near Two-Year High as Stocks Struggle

Date: January 3, 2024

Source: Reuters

The dollar remains close to a two-year high as investors anticipate a widening growth gap between the U.S. and other economies, despite recent fluctuations in currency values and European gas price concerns.

  • European gas prices worry investors, impacting the euro and pound.
  • China's yuan and stocks are under significant pressure.
  • Trump's policies are influencing market sentiment.
  • U.S. share futures rose following a decline in Tesla stocks.
Ken Broux states, "If a currency’s valuation is an expression of the degree of confidence in the growth outlook relative to other economies, it is a damning assessment of how the market reads the euro zone outlook versus that of the U.S. in 2025."

The strength of the dollar reflects deep concerns over alternative economies, particularly in Europe and China, suggesting that the market anticipates significant shifts in growth dynamics.

item.title: Major exit from Kotak Mahindra Bank - COO Milind Nagnur resigns | Check resignation letter, know reason - ET Now
item.description:
Milind Nagnur Resigns as COO of Kotak Mahindra Bank

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: ET Now News

Milind Nagnur announced his resignation as the Chief Operating Officer (COO) and Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of Kotak Mahindra Bank, effective February 15, 2025, citing personal reasons for his departure.

  • Nagnur expressed gratitude for the support from his former managers and the board throughout his tenure.
  • The bank has implemented an interim technology organization structure following Nagnur's resignation.
  • Nagnur plans to relocate back to the US to take care of family members.
“Due to personal reasons, please accept my resignation from the firm... I am immensely grateful to the countless number of friends, colleagues and mentors for making this journey so worthwhile.”

This resignation marks a significant change in the management of Kotak Mahindra Bank as Nagnur was a critical part of its technology transformation.

item.title: Jumped Deposit Scam: Entering PIN To Check Balance Could Drain Your Bank Account - News18
item.description:
Jumped Deposit Scam: Entering PIN To Check Balance Could Drain Your Bank Account

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Cybercriminals are exploiting UPI users in a new scam where entering a PIN to check account balances can lead to fund withdrawals.

  • Scam dubbed the 'Jumped Deposit Scam' targets UPI users.
  • Victims receive unsolicited money, leading them to check their balance.
  • Entering their PIN allows fraudsters to withdraw funds instantly.
  • Authorities warn to be cautious of unknown UPI credits.

Notable Quotes

The Tamil Nadu Police have issued a warning regarding a scam involving unsolicited UPI payments from unknown senders.

How to Protect One’s Money

  • Wait 15-30 minutes after receiving a credit notification before checking balances.
  • Enter an incorrect PIN to reject any pending transactions.

Users are advised to stay vigilant and employ protective measures to safeguard their accounts from this scam.

item.title: Premium devices demand to push India smartphone mkt to over $50 bn in 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Demand for Premium Smartphones to Drive India's Market Beyond $50 Billion by 2025

Date: January 3, 2023 Source: PTI

India's smartphone market is set to explode, reaching over USD 50 billion by 2025, driven by the rising demand for premium devices, particularly from brands like Apple and Samsung.

  • The market size was approximately USD 37.9 billion in 2021.
  • Apple India reported a total income of ₹67,121.6 crore for the financial year 2024.
  • Samsung's mobile revenue stood at ₹71,157.6 crore.
  • The retail average selling price is anticipated to surpass USD 300 for the first time in 2025.
  • Chinese brands like Vivo, Oppo, and OnePlus are also making strides in the affordable premium segment.
  • OnePlus plans a ₹6,000 crore investment to support local market expansion.
  • The premium segment is expected to exceed 20% market share by 2025.
  • The trend towards premium smartphones is being fueled by consumers' interest in offline stores and AI-powered features.
“The shift towards premiumisation is also being driven by consumers increasingly opting for offline stores, where they can experience premium smartphones first-hand.”

This surge in demand reflects a broader trend in consumer preferences, indicating a shift towards higher-quality devices and increased competition among smartphone manufacturers.

item.title: Thailand Moves to Seize Tycoon’s Assets in $350 Million Scam | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Thailand Moves to Seize Tycoon’s Assets in $350 Million Scam

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Bloomberg

Thai authorities are taking action to seize assets of Boon Vanasin, a hospital tycoon accused of defrauding investors out of over 12 billion baht ($350 million) through fake medical projects.

  • Boon Vanasin, the founder of Thonburi Healthcare Group, is wanted on charges of fraud and money laundering.
  • He allegedly misled hundreds of investors into believing in nonexistent medical projects across Thailand, Laos, and Vietnam.
  • Thirteen suspects, including Boon’s family members, have been arrested, while Boon remains at large after fleeing to China.
  • Shares of Thonburi Healthcare have sharply declined, reflecting the impact of the scandal.
  • Authorities are coordinating with Interpol to track down Boon's location for an arrest.
“This is a special case due to its complexities and the number of victims and economic value,” said Wisanu Chimtrakool, deputy director-general of the DSI.

Boon and his family members deny the allegations, claiming forgery of signatures on related documents, while investigations continue.

item.title: Everything To Know About Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: Dates, Venue, Ticket Price, Visitor Registration, And More - CarDekho
item.description:
Everything To Know About Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17 - January 22, 2025 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 in Delhi will feature 14 carmakers showcasing their upcoming models, along with launches from multiple brands.

Key Points

  • Event hosted at Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi.
  • Free visitor entry from January 19-22; Media Day on January 17.
  • Major brands attending include BMW, Porsche, Maruti, Hyundai.
  • Showcases advancements in vehicle technology and organises additional events like the India Cycle Show.
“The price to be a part of the 2025 Auto Expo is absolutely free.”

Make sure to register online to attend and get the latest updates on the new vehicle displays and innovations.
